title: CNBC Daily Open: The U.S. credit rating is in question
description: Stocks extended their downward slide as the debt limit debacle continues to worry investors.

title: Nvidia's jaw-dropping beat and raise sends its share price to a record high
description: As strong as the results were, the chipmaker's guidance for its current quarter was even more robust.

title: Fitch puts United States’ AAA rating on negative watch, citing debt ceiling fight
description: The nation's AAA long-term foreign-currency issuer default rating is on negative watch by Fitch, one of the big three ratings agencies.

title: Twitter glitches plague Ron DeSantis' much-hyped presidential announcement with Elon Musk
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis' presidential campaign announcement plans evening were derailed by massive technical glitches on Elon Musk's Twitter.

title: Nvidia shares spike 18% on huge forecast beat driven by A.I. chip demand
description: Nvidia is the top provider of advanced GPU chips for artificial intelligence.

title: Iconic singer Tina Turner dies at 83
description: Singer Tina Turner has died at the age of 83 after a long illness, a spokesperson said Wednesday.

title: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis joins presidential race, taking on Trump for GOP nomination
description: The move sets DeSantis against former President Donald Trump in the race for the GOP nomination.

title: Fed officials less confident on the need for more rate hikes, minutes show
description: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday released minutes from its May 2-3 policy meeting.

title: Alphabet CEO promises ‘AI pact,’ discussed pro-Kremlin propaganda in meeting with top EU officials
description: The European Parliament earlier this month greenlit rules for AI, including specific measures for generative AI tools such as ChatGPT and Google's Bard chatbot.

title: Debt ceiling talks hit a snag over spending levels with eight days until default deadline
description: Concerns are growing about whether President Biden and House Speaker McCarthy can reach a deal and pass a bill to raises the debt ceiling before June 1.

title: A.I. poses existential risk of people being 'harmed or killed,' ex-Google CEO Eric Schmidt says
description: Artificial intelligence has been thrust into the center of conversations among policymakers grappling with what the tech should look like in the future.

title: 'Extremely regrettable': SoftBank hits back after S&P cuts credit rating further into junk
description: SoftBank offered a sharp rebuke on Wednesday to S&P Global Ratings after the agency downgraded the Japanese giant's credit rating.

title: Without a hint of irony over Ukraine, Putin rages against countries that meddle in other states
description: Russia invaded Ukraine 15 months ago in what is widely seen as the most egregious transgression of national sovereignty in Europe in years.

title: Top EU regulator defends mega $1.3 billion privacy fine on Meta: ‘I have to enforce the law’
description: A top European Union regulator defended a decision to hit Meta with a record-setting fine, saying she had to enforce the law based on existing rules.

title: The U.S. isn't the only country with a debt ceiling. Here's how Denmark avoids the drama
description: A standoff between the White House and Congressional Republicans over raising the U.S. debt ceiling has pushed the world's largest economy to the brink of defaulting on its bills.

title: Chinese Tesla rival shares dive 5% after it forecasts a plunge in car deliveries
description: Xpeng has been hurt by a tough macroeconomic situation in China as well as rising competition from Tesla, BYD and electric car startups.

title: France bans short-haul flights as it looks to cut transport emissions
description: The aviation sector and its effect on the environment sit at the heart of significant debate.

title: Goldman Sachs backs Japan's biggest taxi app with $1 billion valuation
description: Goldman Sachs invested 10 billion Japanese yen ($72.1 million) into Go Inc.

title: Greek stocks have climbed 40% over the last year — as the country shakes off 'problem child of Europe' label
description: A second term for Greece's ruling New Democracy looks likely — in what economists see as good news for the stock market.

title: Europe is producing more startup 'mafias' than ever despite tech rout
description: The development mimics the trend of startup "mafias" in the U.S., where companies like PayPal indirectly helped produce huge businesses like Tesla and Palantir.

title: European banks are stronger than their U.S. rivals, analysts say. Here's why
description: Attendees of the Institute of International Finance conference in Brussels said European banks were in a strong position, but needed support to grow.

title: UK inflation sinks below 10% for the first time since August
description: U.K. inflation dropped sharply in April, as energy prices retreated and the impact of Russia's invasion of Ukraine began to drop out of the annual consumer price comparison.

title: China's tech sector may see fewer regulatory surprises — not zero, says S&P Global Ratings
description: China's tech sector may see its worst days over, but it doesn't mean that regulations will be easing, said S&P Global Ratings in a report.

title: The West’s oil war against Russia is starting to lose momentum
description: The findings show that Moscow has been able to successfully claw back earnings from fossil fuel exports in recent weeks.

title: Japan and South Korea have a lot at stake in a free and open South China Sea
description: For two of East Asia's biggest trade economies, the South China Sea is critically important.

title: China pledges new audit measures to curb risks and stabilize growth
description: State broadcaster reported late Tuesday China's commitment to ensure Communist Party officials implement measures to stabilize economic growth.

title: China's new ambassador to the U.S. arrives to 'safeguard' Beijing's interests
description: Xie Feng, China's new ambassador to the U.S., arrived in New York Tuesday with a call to "safeguard the interests of China," according to a release.
